interp

Class Interp

  • java.lang.Object
    • interp.Interp

  • public class Interp
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the interpreter of the language.

    • Field Detail

      • Stack

        private Stack Stack
        Memory of the virtual machine.

      • FuncName2Tree

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,AslTree> FuncName2Tree
        Map between function names (keys) and ASTs (values). Each entry of the map stores the root of the AST correponding to the function.

      • stdin

        private java.util.Scanner stdin
        Standard input of the interpreter (System.in).

      • linenumber

        private int linenumber
        Stores the line number of the current statement. The line number is used to report runtime errors.

      • trace

        private java.io.PrintWriter trace
        File to write the trace of function calls.

      • function_nesting

        private int function_nesting
        Nested levels of function calls.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Interp

        public Interp(AslTree T,
              java.lang.String tracefile)
        Constructor of the interpreter. It prepares the main data structures for the execution of the main program.

    • Method Detail

      • Run

        public void Run()
        Runs the program by calling the main function without parameters.

      • getStackTrace

        public java.lang.String getStackTrace()
        Returns the contents of the stack trace

      • getStackTrace

        public java.lang.String getStackTrace(int nitems)
        Returns a summarized contents of the stack trace

      • MapFunctions

        private void MapFunctions(AslTree T)
        Gathers information from the AST and creates the map from function names to the corresponding AST nodes.

      • PreProcessAST

        private void PreProcessAST(AslTree T)
        Performs some pre-processing on the AST. Basically, it calculates the value of the literals and stores a simpler representation. See AslTree.java for details.

      • lineNumber

        public int lineNumber()
        Gets the current line number. In case of a runtime error, it returns the line number of the statement causing the error.

      • setLineNumber

        private void setLineNumber(AslTree t)
        Defines the current line number associated to an AST node.

      • setLineNumber

        private void setLineNumber(int l)
        Defines the current line number with a specific value

      • executeFunction

        private Data executeFunction(java.lang.String funcname,
                             AslTree args)
        Executes a function.
        Parameters:
        funcname - The name of the function.
        args - The AST node representing the list of arguments of the caller.
        Returns:
        The data returned by the function.

      • executeListInstructions

        private Data executeListInstructions(AslTree t)
        Executes a block of instructions. The block is terminated as soon as an instruction returns a non-null result. Non-null results are only returned by "return" statements.
        Parameters:
        t - The AST of the block of instructions.
        Returns:
        The data returned by the instructions (null if no return statement has been executed).

      • executeInstruction

        private Data executeInstruction(AslTree t)
        Executes an instruction. Non-null results are only returned by "return" statements.
        Parameters:
        t - The AST of the instruction.
        Returns:
        The data returned by the instruction. The data will be non-null only if a return statement is executed or a block of instructions executing a return.

      • evaluateExpression

        private Data evaluateExpression(AslTree t)
        Evaluates the expression represented in the AST t.
        Parameters:
        t - The AST of the expression
        Returns:
        The value of the expression.

      • evaluateBoolean

        private Data evaluateBoolean(int type,
                             Data v,
                             AslTree t)
        Evaluation of Boolean expressions. This function implements a short-circuit evaluation. The second operand is still a tree and is only evaluated if the value of the expression cannot be determined by the first operand.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of operator (token).
        v - First operand.
        t - AST node of the second operand.
        Returns:
        An Boolean data with the value of the expression.

      • checkBoolean

        private void checkBoolean(Data b)
        Checks that the data is Boolean and raises an exception if it is not.

      • checkInteger

        private void checkInteger(Data b)
        Checks that the data is integer and raises an exception if it is not.

      • listArguments

        private java.util.ArrayList<Data> listArguments(AslTree AstF,
                                                AslTree args)
        Gathers the list of arguments of a function call. It also checks that the arguments are compatible with the parameters. In particular, it checks that the number of parameters is the same and that no expressions are passed as parametres by reference.
        Parameters:
        AstF - The AST of the callee.
        args - The AST of the list of arguments passed by the caller.
        Returns:
        The list of evaluated arguments.

      • traceFunctionCall

        private void traceFunctionCall(AslTree f,
                               java.util.ArrayList<Data> arg_values)
        Writes trace information of a function call in the trace file. The information is the name of the function, the value of the parameters and the line number where the function call is produced.
        Parameters:
        f - AST of the function
        arg_values - Values of the parameters passed to the function

      • traceReturn

        private void traceReturn(AslTree f,
                         Data result,
                         java.util.ArrayList<Data> arg_values)
        Writes the trace information about the return of a function. The information is the value of the returned value and of the variables passed by reference. It also reports the line number of the return.
        Parameters:
        f - AST of the function
        result - The value of the result
        arg_values - The value of the parameters passed to the function
